fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend

Class Solution

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.Solution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>

    public final class Solution
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
    Central class of the library. The solution is a set of reagents and ReactionRules. A reagent can be any kind of object or primitive type. It can also be an other Solution. The ReactionRules are objects that implements the interface ReactionRule.
    Author:
    Andreolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur
    See Also:
    ReactionRule

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Solution.Strategy
      Different strategies available for reagent selection sequence.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Solution()
      Default constructor for a Chemical Programming-powered Solution.
      Uses random strategy as default behavior
      Solution(Solution.Strategy s)
      Constructor for a Chemical Programming-powered Solution, with a Strategy parameter.

        public void fireInertEvent(InertEvent e)

        See Also:
        InertEvent, InertEventListener

      • is_inert

        public boolean is_inert()
        Returns true if this solution is inert. A Solution is inert when no more reaction are possible. This means that there is no more ReactionRules that can react; the solution reached a stable state. Note: to be inert, all the solution's inner solutions must be inert as well.
        Returns:
        true if this solution is inert.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this solution contains no elements/reagents.
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
        Returns:
        true if this solution contains no elements/reagents.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the elements/reagents in this solution. As this solution can contain any type of element, the function returns an iterator of Object objects. There are no guarantees concerning the order in which the elements are returned
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>

        an Iterator over the elements in this solution.
        See Also:
        Iterator

      • getReactivesFromType

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getReactivesFromType(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Returns a list containing the elements/reagents in this solution that have the specified type. As this solution can contain any type of element, the function returns a list of Object objects. There are no guarantees concerning the order in which the elements are returned
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the objects needed.
        Returns:
        a List containing the elements of the specified type in this solution.

      • react

        public void react()
        Launches the reaction of this solution. This is the main function that begins the reaction of the solution. After that, the reaction does not stop until the function is_inert returns true or until an InertEvent is fired.
        This function begins by launching the reactions in this solution's inner solutions and declares itself as non inert. All the threads of the reaction rules from this solutions and its inner solutions are started all together. In case this solution does not contain any inner solution nor reaction rule, nothing happens.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(java.lang.Object reagent)
        Removes a single instance of the specified element/reagent from this solution, if it is present. Returns true if this solution contained the specified element/reagent (or equivalently, if this solution changed as a result of the call).
        Specified by:
        remove in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        reagent - Element to be removed from this solution, if present.
        Returns:
        true if an element was removed as a result of this call

      • retainAll

        public boolean retainAll(java.util.Collection<?> c)
        Retains only the elements/reagents in this solution that are contained in the specified collection. In other words, removes from this solution all of its elements that are not contained in the specified collection.
        Specified by:
        retainAll in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        c - Collection containing elements to be retained in this solution.
        Returns:
        true if this collection changed as a result of the call.

      • toArray

        public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a)
        Returns an array containing all of the elements in this solution; the runtime type of the returned array is that of the specified array.
        Specified by:
        toArray in interface java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        a - the array into which the elements of this solution are to be stored, if it is big enough; otherwise, a new array of the same runtime type is allocated for this purpose.
        Returns:
        An array containing all of the elements in this solution in any order.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this solution. The string representation consists of a list of the elements indexed by their type. Here is an example:
        Solution is:
        java.lang.String -> [string1, string2, string3]
        java.lang.Integer -> [int1, int2, int3, int4, int5]
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • wakeAll

        public void wakeAll()
        Notifies all the threads waiting on this solution's instance. This function is called by a reaction rule's thread when it successfully reacted, to wake every thread that was waiting.
